summary: Hay un personaje oculto en el póster oficial de Captain Marvel
title: Hay un personaje oculto en el póster oficial de Captain Marvel
body:
Hay un personaje oculto en el póster oficial de Captain Marvel

Acaba de estrenarse el adelanto en víde oficial de Captain Marvel, que es la gran novedad que todos los fans esperan antes del estreno de una película. Desde que comenzó la producción han salido a la luz todo tipo de detalles al respecto. Tanto sobre los protagonistas como la historia y relacion con otras películas.

https://superluchas.com/cine3/captain-marvel-libera-primer-trailer-completo-y-est…

summary: The Captain Marvel trailer made me lose all hope for the MCU and here’s why
title: The Captain Marvel trailer made me lose all hope for the MCU and here’s why
excerpt: Don’t get me wrong, it’s not that I’m not excited about Captain Marvel, because I am. Or I was until today. For ten years I've prayed for a female-centric superhero film in the MCU, and I
description:
Don’t get me wrong, it’s not that I’m not excited about Captain Marvel, because I am. Or I was until today.

For ten years I’ve prayed for a female-centric superhero film in the MCU, and I am happy we’re finally getting one in 2019. But that is the point. We have waited too long to just have Captain Marvel be the token female film. This shouldn’t just be about filling the “diversity” quota of Marvel (which isn’t that diverse anyway), it should be about getting a film as beautiful and as iconic as all the others. I feel like everybody was just excited about this because it was finally about a woman, not specifically because it was the story of Carol Danvers.

Now, I am well aware that trailers often do not reflect films. Which is why for now I’m directing my little rant at the advertising department who edited the trailer, not the film itself. This trailer did not make me want to see the film. If CM wasn’t part of the MCU and preceded by Marvel’s reputation, I bet many people wouldn’t be intrigued in the slightest.

This trailer felt incredibly impersonal. Who is the protagonist and why am I interested in her story? Captain Marvel shouldn’t be advertised just as the female superhero film. Social media is going crazy with the same four gifs from the trailer with captions like “the future is female”. It baffles me how people aren’t noticing all the things that weren’t right.

Continue reading on thetempest.co

Don’t get me wrong, it’s not that I’m not excited about Captain Marvel, because I am. Or I was until today.

For ten years I’ve prayed for a female-centric superhero film in the MCU, and I am happy we’re finally getting one in 2019. But that is the point. We have waited too long to just have Captain Marvel be the token female film. I feel like everybody was just excited about this because it was finally about a woman, not specifically because it was the story of Carol Danvers.

Now, I am well aware that trailers often do not reflect films. Which is why for now I’m directing my little rant at the advertising department who edited the trailer, not the film itself. This trailer did not make me want to see the film. If CM wasn’t part of the MCU and preceded by Marvel’s reputation, I bet many people wouldn’t be intrigued in the slightest.

This trailer felt incredibly impersonal. Who is the protagonist and why am I interested in her story? Captain Marvel shouldn’t be advertised just as the female superhero film. “Bire Larson didn’t have enough facial expressions in the teaser”.

summary: I’ve seen a few people comment on how serious/not expressive Carol/Brie is in the Captain Marvel trailer and well first of all...
body: I’ve seen a few people comment on how serious/not expressive Carol/Brie is in the Captain Marvel trailer and well first of all Brie is an Oscar-winning actress with TONS of range so it’s not that she can’t act… Brie has talked about how Carol is starting out a member of Starforce and has very much embraced the Kree part of her that is more serious and logical, but the film explores her getting back in touch with her humanity and that’s the part that she ends up leading by. So yeah fuck all y’all haters!
